Document.Title: Constant Fields and Read-Only Fields
Document.Paragraph: Constant fields identify fields whose value is determined at compile time. In C#, constants are always considered to be static. That is, a constant cannot be initialized to the result of calling some runtime method or function.

Read-only fields identify fields whose value is determined when an object is constructed. So read-only fields are set during object construction and no other method can change the value of a read-only field.
The code below demonstrates how to create and use constant and read-only fields.
Of course, the CLR also supports fields that may be read and written to by any method.
